title: Educational System Leadership and Institutional Pressure Management Strategies

context.prior_knowledge: Elementary educational administration knowledge and understanding of organizational management principles
context.additional_context: Course analyzing institutional pressures and leadership response strategies across diverse educational systems (public/private/blended). Blended learning environment using online discussions, case studies, and role-playing

learning_goals: Learners can classify and explain at least three types of institutional pressures faced by educational system leaders
Learners can propose infrastructure-building strategies for securing organizational legitimacy by applying them to real-world cases
Learners can design resource coordination plans for collaborating with government/non-government agencies to address educational equity issues
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
